VIII.iv.6.B.1.b
.
Analysis of Claims Under 38 U.S.C. 1151
Claims for compensation under
38 U.S.C. 1151
require a five-part analysis.Â  The table below describes the facts that must be established in order to grant compensation under
38 U.S.C. 1151
.
Element
Facts to be Established
References
1
Additional disability or death has occurred.
For more information on determining whether additional disability has occurred, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 6.B.1.c
.
2
Additional disability or death is not due to
willful misconduct, or
continuation or natural progression of disease or injury.
For more information on
willful misconduct, see
38 CFR 3.1(n)
, and
M21-1, Part X, Subpart iv, 1.C
, and
determining that the additional disability or death was not due to continuation or natural progression of disease or injury, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 6.B.4.f
.
3
Additional disability or death is caused by
VA care
participation in vocational rehabilitation, or
participation in CWT.
For more information on
VA care covered under
38 U.S.C. 1151
, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 6.B.2.a
Vocational rehabilitation covered under
38 U.S.C. 1151
, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 6.B.2.d
CWT covered under
38 U.S.C. 1151
, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 6.B.2.e
, and
establishing proximate cause in claims under
38 U.S.C. 1151
, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 6.B.3.b
.
4
If VA care is the cause of disability or death, the evidence must establish that
fault was involved, or
the injury or death resulted from an event not reasonably foreseeable.
For more information on
establishing fault in
38 U.S.C. 1151
claims, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 6.B.3.c
determining whether an injury or death resulted from an event not reasonably foreseeable, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 6.B.3.e
, and
changes in the fault requirement resulting from
Public Law (PL) 104-204,
Section 422, effective October 1, 1997, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 6.B.3.d
.
5
The circumstances and/or location in which the disability or death was incurred are covered under
38 U.S.C. 1151
.
For more information on circumstances or locations in which disability or death is covered under
38 U.S.C. 1151
for
VA care, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 6.B.2.c
vocational rehabilitation, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 6.B.2.d
, and
CWT see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 6.B.2.e
.
